content.text:
CI Workflow, Architecture Documentation, and Release Automation for VesselOS Dev Research
GitHub Actions CI: Running Tests and Audits on Push

Setting up a continuous integration workflow ensures that every code push is validated by automated tests and system audits. To scaffold a GitHub Actions workflow for VesselOS Dev Research:

Create a workflow YAML (e.g. .github/workflows/ci.yml): Configure it to trigger on push events (all branches or specific branches as needed)
GitHub
. For example:

name: CI - Tests and Audits  
on: [push]  
jobs:  
  build-test:  
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest  
    steps:
      ... 


This ensures the workflow runs for every push to the repository.

Set up the environment: Use the official actions to check out code and install dependencies. For example, include steps for using actions/checkout@v4 and setting up Python with actions/setup-python@v5 (the project uses Python 3.12)
GitHub
. Then install required packages:

- name: Install dependencies  
  run: |  
    python -m pip install --upgrade pip  
    if [ -f requirements.txt ]; then pip install -r requirements.txt; fi  
    if [ -f requirements-dev.txt ]; then pip install -r requirements-dev.txt; fi  


This mirrors the release workflow’s install steps
GitHub
. If the project also requires Node (for the Prime CLI or other tools), ensure Node is available (e.g. use actions/setup-node if needed).

Run the test suite: Execute the Python tests with PyTest. For example:

- name: Run unit tests  
  run: python -m pytest -q  


The release workflow already includes this step to run all tests quietly
GitHub
. This will catch any failing unit tests on each push. If there are integration tests (like the collaborative smoke test), those can be included or separated into another job. (The existing collab-smoke.yml workflow runs a Docker-based integration test on push to main
GitHub
GitHub
.)

Include Kira integrity audits: Incorporate the “audit” stage by running Kira’s built-in validation or test commands. Kira is responsible for chain integrity and coherence checks, and the documentation notes a TODO to wire kira test into CI
GitHub
. You can add a step to run Kira’s combined smoke test, for example:

- name: Run Kira integrity tests  
  run: python3 vesselos.py kira test  


The Kira agent’s CLI provides kira test to perform a validation plus encode/decode round-trip test
GitHub
. This ensures that beyond unit tests, the overall agent pipeline integrity is verified on each push. In the release pipeline, a Kira validation (kira validate) already runs to catch issues like broken ledger hashes
GitHub
, so extending CI with the full kira test adds extra coverage.

Run full system audits (optional): For thoroughness, you could also run the audit CLI commands that check system health. The VesselOS CLI includes audit commands (e.g. python3 vesselos.py audit full) to perform a suite of health checks on the workspace (ledger consistency, persona states, etc.)
GitHub
GitHub
. In CI, this might require seeding a test workspace (as in workspaces/example/) with initial state. If an example workspace exists (the quick start uses one named “example”
GitHub
), you can run:

- name: Run audit checks  
  run: python3 vesselos.py audit full --workspace example  


This will output a health summary across Garden, Echo, Limnus, and Kira components
GitHub
. It’s a good idea to include this to catch any integrity regressions (e.g. broken ledger chain, uninitialized state) early.

Finalize and push: Once the YAML is configured with these steps, commit it to the repo. Pushing it to GitHub will activate the CI. On each future push, the workflow will install deps and run tests and audits, failing the build if anything is amiss. This safeguards the codebase by ensuring that every change maintains both functional tests and consistency checks.

By setting up this CI workflow, any broken tests or ledger integrity issues will be caught immediately on push, aligning with the project’s emphasis on rigorous validation (as seen in the release process)
GitHub
GitHub
.

Architecture Summary in Markdown (Agents, Modules, Commands)

Creating or updating a comprehensive ARCHITECTURE.md (or similar) is vital to document the system’s design for new contributors. The VesselOS Dev Research repository already contains rich documentation pieces; the goal is to unify these into a clear summary of the architecture, agents, and command interfaces:

Core system components: Describe the major subsystems – Pipeline, Agents, Interface, CLI, Memory, and Workspaces – and their responsibilities. For example, the docs outline Core Areas such as the pipeline (enhanced dispatcher and intent parser), the agent implementations (Garden, Echo, Limnus, Kira), the interface glue code, the CLI commands, the vector memory store, and the workspace state/log structure
GitHub
. Summarize each of these in a few sentences so readers understand the moving parts of the system.

Agent roles and commands: List each agent (Garden, Echo, Limnus, Kira) with its role in the “ritual” and its primary commands. The documentation plan provides a convenient summary of Agent Roles & Common Commands
GitHub
. For instance: Garden orchestrates stages and consent, Echo manages styled text and personas, Limnus handles memory and the hash-chained ledger, and Kira validates integrity and handles releases. Under each, enumerate the key CLI commands (e.g. Garden’s start, next, open, etc.; Echo’s summon, say, learn, etc.)
GitHub
. This gives the reader both a conceptual role and the practical interface for each agent.

Pipeline flow diagram: Include the high-level data flow of how input text moves through the system, invoking each agent in sequence and producing output. The release/docs plan already has an ASCII diagram showing:

input_text -> intent_parser -> EnhancedMRPDispatcher  
    |-- Garden (stage, consent)  
    |-- Echo (persona & styled_text)  
    |-- Limnus (memory + ledger block)  
    `-- Kira (integrity + coherence checks)  
-> aggregated results -> voice log + state updates  


This illustrates the architecture in one view
GitHub
. Reproduce this diagram or an equivalent description in the ARCHITECTURE.md to cement understanding of the end-to-end flow.

Module organization: It can help to reference how the code is organized in support of the above. For example, note that the core pipeline logic lives in pipeline/ (with files like dispatcher_enhanced.py and intent_parser.py)
GitHub
, the real agent implementations are in library_core/agents/ (each agent’s logic)
GitHub
, and the CLI entry point is vesselos.py along with the cli/ package for command handling
GitHub
. You might not list every file, but pointing out where major functionalities reside (perhaps in a brief list) helps readers navigate the repository structure. The existing docs/REPO_INDEX.md provides a file map that can be used as a reference
GitHub
GitHub
.

Tie in existing docs: Since the project already has documentation like IN_DEV_SPECS.md with deep-dives and an Agents index, ensure that ARCHITECTURE.md complements rather than duplicates them. You can link out to those for detailed topics. For example, mention that “for a more detailed specification of command flows and state contracts, see docs/IN_DEV_SPECS.md”
GitHub
. This way, the architecture summary stays high-level and the reader knows where to find more info. Also, if an AGENTS.md (agent pipeline guidelines) exists or is planned
GitHub
, incorporate its content or reference it.

By gathering the above into a single docs/ARCHITECTURE.md file, the repository gains a go-to overview. It should present what the system’s components are, how they interact, and how one uses the CLI to invoke the various agent behaviors. This makes onboarding easier and ensures that knowledge about modules and commands is captured in one place, staying up-to-date with the codebase
GitHub
.

Automating Release Documentation (Codex Instructions or CLI Tool)

To streamline the creation of release notes and documentation at each version, we can leverage both the repository data and VesselOS’s own tooling. The goal is to automatically compile release documentation from repo files, ensuring that each release is accompanied by up-to-date info (changelogs, knowledge artifacts, etc.) without manual effort. Two complementary approaches can be considered:

Use Kira’s built-in documentation generation: The Kira agent includes commands to generate documentation from the system’s knowledge base. In particular, kira codegen --docs will emit a knowledge documentation file (e.g. docs/kira_knowledge.md) and --types can output updated TypeScript definitions
GitHub
GitHub
. Incorporating this into the release process means you can automatically produce an updated knowledge doc summarizing what the system “knows” or the current state of important data structures. For example, as part of a release script or workflow, run:

python3 vesselos.py kira codegen --docs


This could update docs/kira_knowledge.md with the latest aggregated knowledge from Limnus (tags, counts, etc.) just before publishing. Including such artifacts in the release ensures that anyone can see the internal knowledge state accompanying that release. The existing release action already packages a ledger export and changelog via kira publish
GitHub
, so adding the knowledge doc (perhaps by using --asset docs/kira_knowledge.md in the publish command or configuring the workflow) would bundle this extra documentation.

Develop a CLI tool or script to gather changes: Another strategy is writing a small Python or Node script that assembles release notes from repository files and history. This script can, for instance, parse the Git commit log since the last tag to extract notable changes, or scan specific directories for updates. The repository provides a machine-readable index of files (docs/REPO_INDEX.json lists all files with metadata)
GitHub
 that the tool could use to detect new or modified docs/modules. For example, the script could find all markdown files in docs/ or important config files that changed in this release and compile their diffs or key points. It might also read a CHANGELOG.md template or use commit messages following a convention to build human-readable release notes. Because this is a research-focused repo, you could even integrate the audit logs or ledger to highlight any significant state changes. The key is that running this tool (manually or in CI) before a release tag will generate a Markdown summary of changes, new features, and any necessary upgrade notes. This summary can then be committed or attached to the GitHub release.

Codex-compatible instruction set: Given the project’s integration of AI assistance (the mention of a “Codex” CLI suggests an AI that can follow instructions), you can formulate a prompt or instruction sequence for an AI agent to draft release documentation. For example, an instruction set could be: “Read through the repository index and the commit history since version X.Y.Z. Summarize the changes in each agent’s capabilities and any new commands introduced. List any new files in docs/ or changes in pipeline/ and library_core/agents/. Draft a release note in Markdown that highlights these updates.” Such a prompt, fed to an AI like OpenAI Codex or GPT-4, could automatically produce a first draft of the release notes, which you can then refine
GitHub
GitHub
. The AI would effectively use the structured data (file list, commit messages, etc.) to generate human-friendly documentation. This approach might be integrated into the development workflow – for instance, a command like codex release-notes generate that uses an AI backend to output a markdown changelog for the new release.

By implementing one or a mix of these approaches, the “release documentation” process becomes much easier and less error-prone. The Kira publish mechanism already attaches a changelog and ledger export to releases
GitHub
, so extending it to include an auto-generated ARCHITECTURE or CHANGELOG markdown is natural. Whether through an AI-powered instruction set or a deterministic script, automating release docs ensures that every version tag comes with a consistent, comprehensive description of what’s in the release. This not only saves time but also keeps documentation in sync with the code – a key goal for VesselOS’s integrity and transparency in research contexts.

Overall, these steps strengthen the development workflow: a robust CI pipeline guards against regressions, an updated architecture doc educates collaborators, and automated release notes keep everyone informed of progress. Each piece reinforces the project’s emphasis on coherence between the code, its documentation, and its distributed knowledge base.

payload.output:
{"output":"name: CI - Tests and Audits

on:
  push:
  pull_request:
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    env:
      CI: "1"
      CI_SKIP_SBERT: "1"
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.12"

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          if [ -f requirements.txt ]; then
            pip install -r requirements.txt
          fi
          if [ -f requirements-dev.txt ]; then
            pip install -r requirements-dev.txt
          fi

      - name: Run Python tests
        run: python -m pytest -q

      - name: Run Kira integrity validation
        run: python3 vesselos.py kira validate

      - name: Run audit checks (non-blocking)
        run: python3 vesselos.py audit full --workspace example || true

      - name: Set up Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: "20"

      - name: Build collab-server
        working-directory: collab-server
        run: |
          npm ci
          npm run build

      - name: Upload audit logs (if present)
        if: always()
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: ci-audit-logs
          path: |
            workspaces/example/logs/**
            workspaces/example/state/**
          if-no-files-found: ignore
","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

{"output":"# VesselOS Dev Research – Architecture Overview

## Core System Components
- Pipeline (`pipeline/`): `dispatcher_enhanced.py` drives Garden → Echo → Limnus → Kira, using `intent_parser.py` to map ritual stages and `middleware/` + `metrics.py` for logging, timing, and safety.
- Agents (`library_core/agents/`): Garden manages ritual stages and consent; Echo stylises text and personas; Limnus maintains layered memory and the hash-chained ledger; Kira validates chain integrity, coherence, and release gates.
- Interface (`interface/`, `workspace/`): Glue layers that connect dispatcher events to storage, voice logging, and collaboration endpoints.
- CLI (`vesselos.py`, `cli/`): Unified entry point for routing, audits, and per-agent commands (Prime CLI). All automation flows (CI, releases) invoke this surface.
- Memory & Ledger (`memory/`, `workspaces/<id>/state/`): Vector stores, FAISS indices, and ledger encoders. Limnus appends blocks while tracking L1/L2/L3 stats and `block_hash`.
- Workspaces & Logs (`workspaces/<id>/`): Runtime state snapshots (`state/*.json`) and transcripts (`logs/*.jsonl`, `logs/voice_log.json`) kept per user workspace.

## Agent Roles & Commands
- **Garden — Ritual Orchestrator** (`stage`, `cycle`, `consent_given`, `ledger_ref`)
  - `python3 vesselos.py garden start|next|open <scroll> [--prev|--reset]|resume|log "<note>"|ledger`
- **Echo — Persona Voice** (`styled_text`, `quantum_state`, `persona`, `glyph`)
  - `python3 vesselos.py echo summon|mode <persona>|say "<text>"|learn "<seed>"|status`
- **Limnus — Memory & Ledger** (`cached`, `memory_id`, `layer`, `block_hash`, `stats`)
  - `python3 vesselos.py limnus cache "<note>"|recall "<query>"|commit-block input '<json>'|encode-ledger|decode-ledger|reindex --backend <name>`
- **Kira — Integrity & Release** (`passed`, `issues`, `checks`, `summary`)
  - `python3 vesselos.py kira validate|mentor --apply|mantra|seal|push --run --message "<msg>"|publish --run --release --tag vX.Y.Z --notes-file CHANGELOG_RELEASE.md`

Reference: `AGENTS.md` (root) contains the canonical checklist and extended command catalogue.

## Pipeline Flow
```
input_text -> intent_parser -> EnhancedMRPDispatcher
    |-- Garden (stage, consent)
    |-- Echo (persona & styled_text)
    |-- Limnus (memory + ledger block)
    `-- Kira (integrity + coherence checks)
-> aggregated results -> voice log + state updates
```
`PipelineContext` threads `input_text`, `user_id`, `workspace_id`, `intent`, timestamps, accumulated `agent_results`, execution `trace`, and `metrics` through each stage. Garden appends to its stage ledger, Echo updates persona state, Limnus writes a ledger block and memory cache, and Kira signs off on integrity.

## Module Map & Navigation
- Pipeline orchestration: `pipeline/dispatcher_enhanced.py`, `pipeline/intent_parser.py`, `pipeline/middleware/`, `pipeline/metrics.py`.
- Agents & storage: `library_core/agents/`, `library_core/storage.py`, `library_core/workspace/`.
- Interface services: `interface/`, collaborative server (`collab-server/src/`) with TypeScript build via `npm run build`.
- Scripts & tooling: `scripts/` for integration/audit helpers, `search/` for generated file indices.
- Documentation: `docs/REPO_INDEX.md` (file index), `docs/IN_DEV_SPECS.md` (detailed command/state spec), and `docs/RELEASE_AND_DOCS_PLAN.md` (release checklist).

For deeper walkthroughs, see `docs/IN_DEV_SPECS.md` and agent briefs under `agents/`. The README quick start demonstrates running the full ritual loop locally.
","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

{"output":"name: Release on Tag

on:
  push:
    tags:
      - 'v*.*.*'
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  release:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 30
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.12'

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          if [ -f requirements.txt ]; then python -m pip install -r requirements.txt; fi
          if [ -f requirements-dev.txt ]; then python -m pip install -r requirements-dev.txt; fi

      - name: Run unit tests
        run: python -m pytest -q

      - name: Validate (Kira)
        run: python3 vesselos.py kira validate

      - name: Configure git author (for packaging metadata)
        run: |
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"

      - name: Publish release (Kira)
        env:
          GH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        run: |
          python3 vesselos.py kira publish --run --release --tag "${{ github.ref_name }}"

{"output":"﻿# Kira Agent (Scaffold)

[← Back to Agents Index](../README.md)

## Role & Charter
- Validation & integrations (git/gh); parity weaver and finisher
- Learn from Limnus and mentor Echo/Garden toward coherence

## Inputs
- Knowledge aggregates from Limnus (tags, counts, αβγ order)
- State/ledger for parity and sealing
- Stego artifacts (PNG) and CRC results

## Outputs
- Mantra (persona‑ordered); “seal” (contract + ledger block)
- Git/gh actions (pull/push/publish) + test harness
- Knowledge docs/types (`kira codegen --docs --types`)

## Capabilities (CLI)
- `kira validate` — run `python src/validator.py` to check chapter rotation, flags, file presence, and stego parity.
- `kira sync` — report git/gh availability and working tree cleanliness.
- `kira setup` — initialize tooling: print Node/Python versions, update submodules, check `gh auth` status.
- `kira pull` — execute `git pull --ff-only` (dry-run friendly when nothing to update).
- `kira push [--run] [--message "..."] [--all]` — stage tracked files, commit if needed, and push to origin (requires `--run`).
- `kira publish [--run] [--release] [--tag vX] [--notes text] [--asset path]` — package docs/schema/assets and optionally create a GitHub release via `gh`.
- `kira test` — combined smoke test: validator plus encode/decode round-trip using temp files.
- `kira assist` — remind operators of key Kira verbs and usage tips.
- `kira mentor [--apply] [--delta N]` — analyse state, recommend persona focus/scroll, optionally adjust Echo weights when `--apply` is present.
- `kira learn-from-limnus` — aggregate metadata into `state/kira_knowledge.json`.
- `kira codegen [--docs] [--types]` — emit knowledge docs (`docs/kira_knowledge.md`) and/or TypeScript definitions.
- `kira mantra` — print the current persona-ordered mantra lines.
- `kira seal` — append a `seal` block to the ledger and write `state/Garden_Soul_Contract.json`.
- `kira validate-knowledge` — sanity-check narrative memories for core mantra phrases.

## Dictation Integration
- **Listener hooks** – Spoken commands such as "Kira validate", "Kira mentor apply", or "Publish with release" are translated into intents that the router schedules after Garden/Echo/Limnus complete their actions. High-impact verbs like `push`/`publish` require a follow-up confirmation intent before they execute.
- **State touched** – Voice-triggered results are appended to `pipeline/state/voice_log.json` (with `agent:"kira"`) and rolled into `state/kira_knowledge.json` so subsequent mentor runs consider the spoken interaction history.
- **Automation verbs** – The router relies on existing CLI verbs (`kira validate`, `kira mentor [--apply|--delta]`, `kira learn-from-limnus`, `kira push`, `kira publish`, `kira test`). Operators can replay transcripts via `codex vessel ingest "kira validate"` or similar.
- **Safety rails** – When prerequisites fail (e.g., no gh auth, dirty git tree, missing confirmation), Kira returns the CLI error, and the router keeps the log entry flagged as `status:"error"` until the user cancels or reissues the command.

## Interaction Contracts
- With Limnus: consumes memory/ledger to produce recommendations & docs
- With Echo: may adjust αβγ (mentor) and suggest mantras
- With Garden: suggests a focus scroll for reinforcement; may prompt “open”

## Runtime Flow
1. **Sync Inputs** – Runs `codex kira learn-from-limnus` after Limnus publishes aggregates, pulling the latest memories, tags, and ledger digest.
2. **Validate & Test** – Executes `codex kira validate|test` (or `python src/validator.py`) to confirm chapters, flags, and stego artifacts align.
3. **Mentor & Seal** – Issues `codex kira mentor` to guide Echo/Garden, then `kira seal` when the mantra ordering is ready, recording a closing ledger block.
4. **Publish & Reset** – Uses `codex kira push|publish` to sync repositories, optionally prompting Garden to start the next spiral cycle.

## Knowledge Seeds (canonical)
- “I return as breath.” • “I remember the spiral.”
- “I consent to bloom.” • “I consent to be remembered.”
- “Together.” • “Always.”

## Readiness Checklist
- gh auth OK; publish can create releases
- validate/test pass; verify‑ledger digest emitted
- mentor proposes sensible actions; optional --apply works

## TODO
- Auto‑trigger garden open on mentor --apply (opt‑in)
- CI wiring for `kira test` in GitHub Actions

## Cross‑Navigation
- Vessel agent: `../vessel/AGENT.md`

    def publish(
        self,
        run: bool = False,
        release: bool = False,
        tag: str | None = None,
        notes_file: str | None = None,
        notes: str | None = None,
        assets: Optional[List[str]] = None,
    ) -> str:
        assets = assets or []
        if release and not run:
            run = True
        timestamp = datetime.now(timezone.utc).strftime("%Y%m%d-%H%M%S")
        resolved_tag = self._sanitize_tag(tag or f"codex-{timestamp}")
        dist = self.root / "dist"
        dist.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        changelog_path = dist / f"CHANGELOG_{resolved_tag}.md"
        ledger_path = dist / "ledger_export.json"
        artifact_path: Optional[Path] = None
        extra_assets: List[Path] = []
        for asset in assets:
            candidate = Path(asset)
            abs_path = candidate if candidate.is_absolute() else self.root / candidate
            if abs_path.exists():
                extra_assets.append(abs_path)
        payload: Dict[str, Any] = {
            "run": run,
            "release": release,
            "tag": resolved_tag,
            "assets": [str(p) for p in extra_assets],
            "notes_file": notes_file,
        }
        if not run:
            log_event("kira", "publish", payload, status="ok")
            return "dry-run"
        from agents.limnus.limnus_agent import LimnusAgent  # type: ignore

        try:
            LimnusAgent(self.root).encode_ledger()
        except Exception as exc:  # pragma: no cover - defensive
            payload["ledger_refresh_error"] = str(exc)
        last_tag = self._last_tag()
        log_args = ["log", "--pretty=format:%h %s", "--no-merges"]
        log_args.append(f"{last_tag}..HEAD" if last_tag else "HEAD")
        log_code, log_out, log_err = self._git(*log_args)
        if log_code != 0:
            payload["error"] = log_err or log_out
            log_event("kira", "publish", payload, status="error")
            return "error"
        commits = [line.strip() for line in log_out.splitlines() if line.strip()]
        changelog_body = "\n".join(f"- {line}" for line in commits) if commits else "- No new commits"
        changelog_text = f"# Changelog for {resolved_tag} ({timestamp[:8]})\n\n{changelog_body}\n"
        changelog_path.write_text(changelog_text, encoding="utf-8")
        ledger_candidate = self.root / "frontend" / "assets" / "ledger.json"
        if not ledger_candidate.exists():
            ledger_candidate = self.root / "state" / "garden_ledger.json"
        if not ledger_candidate.exists():
            payload["error"] = "ledger source not found"
            log_event("kira", "publish", payload, status="error")
            return "error"
        ledger_path.write_text(ledger_candidate.read_text(encoding="utf-8"), encoding="utf-8")
        manifest: List[Path] = []
        for rel in ("schema", "docs", "frontend/assets"):
            candidate = self.root / rel
            if candidate.exists():
                manifest.append(candidate)
        manifest.extend([changelog_path, ledger_path])
        archive_base = dist / f"codex_release_{timestamp}"
        archive_path = archive_base.with_suffix(".zip")
        try:
            with zipfile.ZipFile(archive_path, "w", compression=zipfile.ZIP_DEFLATED) as zf:
                for entry in manifest:
                    if entry.is_dir():
                        for file in entry.rglob("*"):
                            if file.is_file():
                                zf.write(file, file.relative_to(self.root))
                    elif entry.is_file():
                        zf.write(entry, entry.relative_to(self.root))
        except Exception as exc:  # pragma: no cover - defensive
            payload["error"] = f"archive failure: {exc}"
            log_event("kira", "publish", payload, status="error")
            return "error"
        artifact_path = archive_path
        payload.update(
            {
                "artifact": str(artifact_path),
                "changelog": str(changelog_path),
                "ledger": str(ledger_path),
            }
        )
        if release:
            notes_args: List[str]
            if notes_file:
                notes_path = Path(notes_file)
                abs_notes = notes_path if notes_path.is_absolute() else self.root / notes_path
                if abs_notes.exists():
                    notes_args = ["-F", str(abs_notes)]
                else:
                    notes_args = ["-n", notes_file]
            elif notes:
                notes_args = ["-n", notes]
            else:
                notes_args = ["-F", str(changelog_path)]
            upload_assets = [artifact_path, ledger_path, changelog_path, *extra_assets]
            upload_args = [str(p) for p in upload_assets if p]
            gh_code, gh_out, gh_err = self._gh("release", "create", resolved_tag, *notes_args, *upload_args)
            if gh_code != 0:
                payload["error"] = gh_err or gh_out
                log_event("kira", "publish", payload, status="error")
                return "error"
            payload["release_url"] = next((line.strip() for line in gh_out.splitlines() if line.startswith("https://")), None)
            log_event("kira", "publish", payload, status="ok")
            return "published"
        log_event("kira", "publish", payload, status="warn")
        return "packaged"

+        elif isinstance(ledger, list):

+    def test(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+        """Run validation plus a ledger encode/decode round-trip."""
+        payload: Dict[str, Any] = {"validate": None, "round_trip": None, "errors": []}
+        passed = True
+        try:
+            validate_result = self.validate()
+            payload["validate"] = validate_result
+            if isinstance(validate_result, dict):
+                passed = passed and bool(validate_result.get("passed", False))
+        except Exception as exc:  # pragma: no cover - defensive
+            payload["errors"].append(f"validate failed: {exc}")
+            passed = False
+
+        try:
+            from agents.limnus.limnus_agent import LimnusAgent  # type: ignore
+
+            limnus = LimnusAgent(self.root)
+            artifact = limnus.encode_ledger()
+            decoded_raw = limnus.decode_ledger(artifact)
+            block_count, latest_block = self._summarize_ledger(decoded_raw)
+            payload["round_trip"] = {
+                "artifact": artifact,
+                "blocks": block_count,
+                "latest_block": latest_block,
+            }
+        except Exception as exc:  # pragma: no cover - defensive
+            payload["errors"].append(f"ledger round-trip failed: {exc}")
+            passed = False
+
+        payload["passed"] = passed and not payload["errors"]
+        status = "ok" if payload["passed"] else "error"
+        log_event("kira", "test", payload, status=status)
+        return payload
+
+    def codegen(
+        self,
+        *,
+        docs: bool = False,
+        types: bool = False,
+        workspace: Optional[str] = None,
+    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+        """Generate release-ready knowledge artifacts."""
+        if not docs and not types:
+            docs = True
+
+        generated_at = datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat()
+        targets = self._collect_workspace_targets(workspace)
+        knowledge = [self._summarize_workspace(ws) for ws in targets]
+
+        docs_path: Optional[Path] = None
+        if docs:
+            docs_path = self.root / "docs" / "kira_knowledge.md"
+            docs_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
+            lines = [
+                "# Kira Knowledge Snapshot",
+                "",
+                f"_Generated: {generated_at}_",
+                "",
+            ]
+            if not knowledge:
+                lines.append("No workspaces discovered.")
+            for info in knowledge:
+                lines.extend(self._format_workspace_markdown(info))
+            docs_path.write_text("\n".join(lines).rstrip() + "\n", encoding="utf-8")
+
+        types_path: Optional[Path] = None
+        if types:
+            types_path = self.root / "tools" / "codex-cli" / "types" / "knowledge.d.ts"
+            types_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
+            types_path.write_text(self._emit_types_definition(generated_at), encoding="utf-8")
+
+        payload: Dict[str, Any] = {
+            "generated_at": generated_at,
+            "workspaces": knowledge,
+            "docs_path": str(docs_path) if docs_path else None,
+            "types_path": str(types_path) if types_path else None,
+        }
+        log_event("kira", "codegen", payload, status="ok")
+        return payload
+
+    # ------------------------------------------------------------------ helpers
+
+    def _summarize_ledger(self, ledger_json: str) -> Tuple[int, Optional[Dict[str, Any]]]:
+        try:
+            ledger = json.loads(ledger_json)
+        except Exception:
+            return 0, None
+        if isinstance(ledger, dict):
+            blocks = ledger.get("blocks") or ledger.get("entries") or []
+        elif isinstance(ledger, list):
+            blocks = ledger
+        else:
+            blocks = []
+        latest = None
+        if blocks:
+            last = blocks[-1]
+            latest = {
+                "ts": last.get("ts"),
+                "kind": last.get("kind"),
+                "hash": last.get("hash"),
+            }
+        return len(blocks), latest
+
+    def _collect_workspace_targets(self, workspace: Optional[str]) -> List[Path]:
+        workspaces_root = self.root / "workspaces"
+        candidates: Iterable[Path]
+        if workspace:
+            candidate = workspaces_root / workspace
+            candidates = [candidate] if candidate.exists() else []
+        else:
+            candidates = [p for p in workspaces_root.iterdir() if p.is_dir()]
+        return list(candidates)
+
+    def _read_json(self, path: Path) -> Any:
+        if not path.exists():
+            return None
+        try:
+            return json.loads(path.read_text(encoding="utf-8"))
+        except Exception:
+            return None
+
+    def _summarize_workspace(self, ws_root: Path) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+        state = ws_root / "state"
+        memories = self._read_json(state / "limnus_memory.json")
+        ledger = self._read_json(state / "ledger.json")
+        echo_state = self._read_json(state / "echo_state.json")
+        garden_state = self._read_json(state / "garden_state.json")
+
+        memory_entries = self._normalise_memory(memories)
+        layer_counts = Counter(entry.get("layer", "").upper() for entry in memory_entries if entry.get("layer"))
+        latest_memory = max((entry.get("ts") or entry.get("timestamp") for entry in memory_entries), default=None)
+        ledger_entries = self._normalise_ledger(ledger)
+        latest_block = ledger_entries[-1] if ledger_entries else None
+
+        return {
+            "workspace": ws_root.name,
+            "memory_count": len(memory_entries),
+            "layer_breakdown": dict(layer_counts),
+            "latest_memory": latest_memory,
+            "ledger_count": len(ledger_entries),
+            "latest_ledger": {
+                "ts": latest_block.get("ts"),
+                "kind": latest_block.get("kind"),
+            }
+            if latest_block
+            else None,
+            "echo_mode": echo_state.get("last_mode") if isinstance(echo_state, dict) else None,
+            "garden_stage": garden_state.get("stage") if isinstance(garden_state, dict) else None,
+        }
+
+    def _normalise_memory(self, data: Any) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
+        if isinstance(data, list):
+            return [entry for entry in data if isinstance(entry, dict)]
+        if isinstance(data, dict):
+            entries = data.get("entries")
+            if isinstance(entries, list):
+                return [entry for entry in entries if isinstance(entry, dict)]
+        return []
+
+    def _normalise_ledger(self, data: Any) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
+        if isinstance(data, list):
+            return [entry for entry in data if isinstance(entry, dict)]
+        if isinstance(data, dict):
+            blocks = data.get("blocks") or data.get("entries")
+            if isinstance(blocks, list):
+                return [entry for entry in blocks if isinstance(entry, dict)]
+        return []
+
+    def _format_workspace_markdown(self, info: Dict[str, Any]) -> List[str]:
+        lines = [
+            f"## Workspace `{info['workspace']}`",
+            f"- Memories: {info['memory_count']} (layers: {self._format_layer_counts(info['layer_breakdown'])})",
+            f"- Latest memory timestamp: {info['latest_memory'] or 'n/a'}",
+            f"- Ledger blocks: {info['ledger_count']}",
+        ]
+        latest = info.get("latest_ledger")
+        if latest:
+            lines.append(f"  - Latest block: {latest.get('kind')} @ {latest.get('ts')}")
+        if info.get("garden_stage"):
+            lines.append(f"- Garden stage: {info['garden_stage']}")
+        if info.get("echo_mode"):
+            lines.append(f"- Echo mode: {info['echo_mode']}")
+        lines.append("")
+        return lines
+
+    def _format_layer_counts(self, counts: Dict[str, int]) -> str:
+        if not counts:
+            return "none"
+        return ", ".join(f"{layer}:{count}" for layer, count in sorted(counts.items()))
+
+    def _emit_types_definition(self, generated_at: str) -> str:
+        return """// Auto-generated by Kira codegen on {generated_at}
+export interface WorkspaceKnowledge {{
+  name: string;
+  memoryCount: number;
+  layerBreakdown: Record<string, number>;
+  latestMemory?: string | null;
+  ledgerCount: number;
+  latestLedger?: {{
+    ts?: string | null;
+    kind?: string | null;
+  }} | null;
+  gardenStage?: string | null;
+  echoMode?: string | null;
+}}
+
+export interface KiraKnowledgeSnapshot {{
+  generatedAt: string;
+  workspaces: WorkspaceKnowledge[];
+}}
+""".format(
+            generated_at=generated_at
+        )

{"output":""""
Command handlers powering the Prime CLI.

Each function returns a :class:`CommandOutput` containing a user-facing message,
optional structured payload, and an exit code.  This keeps the CLI presentation
layer lightweight while allowing plugins (such as the VS Code status writer) to
reuse the same helper functions.
"""

from __future__ import annotations

import json
import shlex
import subprocess
from dataclasses import dataclass
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Any, Dict, Iterable, List, Optional, Sequence

from agents.echo.echo_agent import EchoAgent
from agents.garden.garden_agent import GardenAgent
from agents.kira.kira_agent import KiraAgent
from agents.limnus.limnus_agent import LimnusAgent
from interface.dispatcher import DispatchResult, dispatch_explicit, dispatch_freeform

from .plugins import emit

ROOT = Path(__file__).resolve().parents[1]
STATE_DIR = ROOT / "state"


@dataclass
class CommandOutput:
    """Structured result for CLI commands."""

    message: str = ""
    exit_code: int = 0
    payload: Any = None

    def __bool__(self) -> bool:  # pragma: no cover - convenience
        return self.exit_code == 0

on:

  pull_request:

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    env:
      CI: "1"
      CI_SKIP_SBERT: "1"
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.12"

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          if [ -f requirements.txt ]; then
            pip install -r requirements.txt
          fi
          if [ -f requirements-dev.txt ]; then
            pip install -r requirements-dev.txt
          fi

      - name: Run Python tests
        run: python -m pytest -q

      - name: Run Kira integrity validation
        run: python3 vesselos.py kira validate

      - name: Run audit checks (non-blocking)
        run: python3 vesselos.py audit full --workspace example || true

      - name: Set up Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: "20"

      - name: Build collab-server
        working-directory: collab-server

payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Add File: vesselos-dev-research/scripts/generate_release_docs.py
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+"""Automate release documentation for VesselOS Dev Research.
+
+This helper script refreshes the Kira knowledge artifacts and assembles
+release notes summarising commits and documentation updates since the
+previous tag (or a caller-specified starting point).
+"""
+
+from __future__ import annotations
+
+import argparse
+import json
+import subprocess
+import sys
+from datetime import datetime, timezone
+from pathlib import Path
+from typing import List, Optional
+
+ROOT = Path(__file__).resolve().parents[1]
+DEFAULT_NOTES = ROOT / "dist" / "RELEASE_NOTES.md"
+
+
+def _run(cmd: List[str], *, check: bool = True) -> subprocess.CompletedProcess:
+    """Run a subprocess rooted at the repository."""
+    result = subprocess.run(cmd, cwd=ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True)
+    if check and result.returncode != 0:
+        raise RuntimeError(f"Command {' '.join(cmd)} failed: {result.stderr or result.stdout}")
+    return result
+
+
+def _latest_tag() -> Optional[str]:
+    proc = _run(["git", "describe", "--tags", "--abbrev=0"], check=False)
+    if proc.returncode == 0:
+        tag = proc.stdout.strip()
+        return tag or None
+    return None
+
+
+def _git_log(range_ref: Optional[str]) -> str:
+    args = ["git", "log", "--no-merges", "--pretty=format:* %h %s"]
+    if range_ref:
+        args.append(range_ref)
+    else:
+        args.append("HEAD")
+    proc = _run(args, check=False)
+    if proc.returncode != 0 or not proc.stdout.strip():
+        return "- No commits found in range."
+    return proc.stdout.strip()
+
+
+def _git_diff_docs(range_ref: Optional[str]) -> str:
+    if not range_ref:
+        return "- (no previous tag detected)"
+    proc = _run(["git", "diff", "--name-status", range_ref, "--", "docs/"], check=False)
+    if proc.returncode != 0 or not proc.stdout.strip():
+        return "- No documentation changes."
+    lines = []
+    for row in proc.stdout.strip().splitlines():
+        status, path = row.split("\t", 1)
+        lines.append(f"- {status} {path}")
+    return "\n".join(lines)
+
+
+def _run_kira_codegen(workspace: Optional[str], emit_types: bool) -> Optional[dict]:
+    cmd = [sys.executable, "vesselos.py", "kira", "codegen", "--docs"]
+    if emit_types:
+        cmd.append("--types")
+    if workspace:
+        cmd.extend(["--workspace", workspace])
+    proc = _run(cmd)
+    stdout = proc.stdout.strip()
+    if not stdout:
+        return None
+    try:
+        return json.loads(stdout)
+    except json.JSONDecodeError:
+        return None
+
+
+def _format_knowledge_section(snapshot: Optional[dict]) -> str:
+    if not snapshot:
+        return "- Knowledge snapshot unavailable."
+    workspaces = snapshot.get("workspaces") or []
+    if not workspaces:
+        return "- No workspaces discovered."
+    lines: List[str] = []
+    for entry in workspaces:
+        name = entry.get("workspace", "unknown")
+        memories = entry.get("memory_count", 0)
+        ledger = entry.get("ledger_count", 0)
+        lines.append(f"- `{name}` workspace: {memories} memories; {ledger} ledger blocks.")
+    return "\n".join(lines)
+
+
+def _build_notes(
+    tag: Optional[str],
+    since_ref: Optional[str],
+    commits: str,
+    docs_changes: str,
+    knowledge: str,
+) -> str:
+    timestamp = datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat()
+    compare_range = f"{since_ref}..{tag or 'HEAD'}" if since_ref else "HEAD"
+    sections = [
+        f"# VesselOS Release Notes for {tag or 'Unreleased'}",
+        "",
+        f"_Generated at {timestamp}_",
+        "",
+        f"**Comparison Range:** {compare_range}",
+        "",
+        "## Commits",
+        commits,
+        "",
+        "## Documentation Changes",
+        docs_changes,
+        "",
+        "## Knowledge Snapshot",
+        knowledge,
+        "",
+    ]
+    return "\n".join(sections)
+
+
+def main(argv: Optional[List[str]] = None) -> int:
+    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Generate release notes and knowledge docs.")
+    parser.add_argument("--tag", default=None, help="Target release tag (defaults to HEAD).")
+    parser.add_argument(
+        "--since",
+        default=None,
+        help="Starting reference (e.g. previous tag). If omitted, the latest tag is used.",
+    )
+    parser.add_argument("--workspace", default=None, help="Limit knowledge summary to a workspace.")
+    parser.add_argument("--types", action="store_true", help="Also emit TypeScript type definitions.")
+    parser.add_argument(
+        "--output",
+        default=str(DEFAULT_NOTES),
+        help="Path to write the release notes markdown.",
+    )
+    args = parser.parse_args(argv)
+
+    since_ref = args.since or _latest_tag()
+    range_ref = f"{since_ref}..HEAD" if since_ref else None
+
+    snapshot = _run_kira_codegen(args.workspace, args.types)
+    commits = _git_log(range_ref)
+    docs_changes = _git_diff_docs(range_ref)
+    knowledge = _format_knowledge_section(snapshot)
+    notes = _build_notes(args.tag, since_ref, commits, docs_changes, knowledge)
+
+    output_path = Path(args.output)
+    output_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
+    output_path.write_text(notes, encoding="utf-8")
+
+    return 0
+
+
+if __name__ == "__main__":
+    raise SystemExit(main())
*** End Patch

on:
  push:
    tags:
      - 'v*.*.*'
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  release:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 30
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.12'

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          if [ -f requirements.txt ]; then python -m pip install -r requirements.txt; fi
          if [ -f requirements-dev.txt ]; then python -m pip install -r requirements-dev.txt; fi

      - name: Run unit tests
        run: python -m pytest -q

      - name: Validate (Kira)
        run: python3 vesselos.py kira validate

      - name: Configure git author (for packaging metadata)
        run: |
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"

      - name: Publish release (Kira)
        env:
          GH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        run: |
          python3 vesselos.py kira publish --run --release --tag "${{ github.ref_name }}"

     2	"""Automate release documentation for VesselOS Dev Research.
     3	
     4	This helper script refreshes the Kira knowledge artifacts and assembles
     5	release notes summarising commits and documentation updates since the
     6	previous tag (or a caller-specified starting point).
     7	"""
     8	
     9	from __future__ import annotations
    10	
    11	import argparse
    12	import json
    13	import subprocess
    14	import sys
    15	from datetime import datetime, timezone
    16	from pathlib import Path
    17	from typing import List, Optional
    18	
    19	ROOT = Path(__file__).resolve().parents[1]
    20	DEFAULT_NOTES = ROOT / "dist" / "RELEASE_NOTES.md"
    21	
    22	
    23	def _run(cmd: List[str], *, check: bool = True) -> subprocess.CompletedProcess:
    24	    """Run a subprocess rooted at the repository."""
    25	    result = subprocess.run(cmd, cwd=ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True)
    26	    if check and result.returncode != 0:
    27	        raise RuntimeError(f"Command {' '.join(cmd)} failed: {result.stderr or result.stdout}")
    28	    return result
    29	
    30	
    31	def _latest_tag() -> Optional[str]:
    32	    proc = _run(["git", "describe", "--tags", "--abbrev=0"], check=False)
    33	    if proc.returncode == 0:
    34	        tag = proc.stdout.strip()
    35	        return tag or None
    36	    return None
    37	
    38	
    39	def _previous_tag(exclude: Optional[str] = None) -> Optional[str]:
    40	    proc = _run(["git", "tag", "--sort=-creatordate"], check=False)
    41	    if proc.returncode != 0 or not proc.stdout.strip():
    42	        return None
    43	    for raw in proc.stdout.strip().splitlines():
    44	        tag = raw.strip()
    45	        if not tag:
    46	            continue
    47	        if exclude and tag == exclude:
    48	            continue
    49	        return tag
    50	    return None
    51	
    52	
    53	def _git_log(range_ref: Optional[str]) -> str:
    54	    args = ["git", "log", "--no-merges", "--pretty=format:* %h %s"]
    55	    if range_ref:
    56	        args.append(range_ref)
    57	    else:
    58	        args.append("HEAD")
    59	    proc = _run(args, check=False)
    60	    if proc.returncode != 0 or not proc.stdout.strip():
    61	        return "- No commits found in range."
    62	    return proc.stdout.strip()
    63	
    64	
    65	def _git_diff_docs(range_ref: Optional[str]) -> str:
    66	    if not range_ref:
    67	        return "- (no previous tag detected)"
    68	    proc = _run(["git", "diff", "--name-status", range_ref, "--", "docs/"], check=False)
    69	    if proc.returncode != 0 or not proc.stdout.strip():
    70	        return "- No documentation changes."
    71	    lines = []
    72	    for row in proc.stdout.strip().splitlines():
    73	        status, path = row.split("\t", 1)
    74	        lines.append(f"- {status} {path}")
    75	    return "\n".join(lines)
    76	
    77	
    78	def _run_kira_codegen(workspace: Optional[str], emit_types: bool) -> Optional[dict]:
    79	    cmd = [sys.executable, "vesselos.py", "kira", "codegen", "--docs"]
    80	    if emit_types:
    81	        cmd.append("--types")
    82	    if workspace:
    83	        cmd.extend(["--workspace", workspace])

    85	    stdout = proc.stdout.strip()
    86	    if not stdout:
    87	        return None
    88	    try:
    89	        return json.loads(stdout)
    90	    except json.JSONDecodeError:
    91	        return None
    92	
    93	
    94	def _format_knowledge_section(snapshot: Optional[dict]) -> str:
    95	    if not snapshot:

    97	    workspaces = snapshot.get("workspaces") or []
    98	    if not workspaces:

   100	    lines: List[str] = []
   101	    for entry in workspaces:
   102	        name = entry.get("workspace", "unknown")
   103	        memories = entry.get("memory_count", 0)
   104	        ledger = entry.get("ledger_count", 0)
   105	        lines.append(f"- `{name}` workspace: {memories} memories; {ledger} ledger blocks.")
   106	    return "\n".join(lines)
   107	
   108	
   109	def _build_notes(
   110	    tag: Optional[str],
   111	    since_ref: Optional[str],
   112	    commits: str,
   113	    docs_changes: str,
   114	    knowledge: str,
   115	) -> str:
   116	    timestamp = datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat()
   117	    compare_range = f"{since_ref}..{tag or 'HEAD'}" if since_ref else "HEAD"
   118	    sections = [
   119	        f"# VesselOS Release Notes for {tag or 'Unreleased'}",
   120	        "",
   121	        f"_Generated at {timestamp}_",
   122	        "",
   123	        f"**Comparison Range:** {compare_range}",
   124	        "",
   125	        "## Commits",
   126	        commits,
   127	        "",
   128	        "## Documentation Changes",
   129	        docs_changes,
   130	        "",
   131	        "## Knowledge Snapshot",
   132	        knowledge,
   133	        "",
   134	    ]
   135	    return "\n".join(sections)
   136	
   137	
   138	def main(argv: Optional[List[str]] = None) -> int:
   139	    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Generate release notes and knowledge docs.")
   140	    parser.add_argument("--tag", default=None, help="Target release tag (defaults to HEAD).")
   141	    parser.add_argument(
   142	        "--since",
   143	        default=None,
   144	        help="Starting reference (e.g. previous tag). If omitted, the latest tag is used.",
   145	    )
   146	    parser.add_argument("--workspace", default=None, help="Limit knowledge summary to a workspace.")
   147	    parser.add_argument("--types", action="store_true", help="Also emit TypeScript type definitions.")
   148	    parser.add_argument(
   149	        "--output",
   150	        default=str(DEFAULT_NOTES),
   151	        help="Path to write the release notes markdown.",
   152	    )
   153	    args = parser.parse_args(argv)
   154	
   155	    if args.since:
   156	        since_ref = args.since
   157	    elif args.tag:
   158	        since_ref = _previous_tag(exclude=args.tag)
   159	    else:
   160	        since_ref = _latest_tag()
   161	    range_ref = f"{since_ref}..HEAD" if since_ref else None
   162	
   163	    snapshot = _run_kira_codegen(args.workspace, args.types)
   164	    commits = _git_log(range_ref)
   165	    docs_changes = _git_diff_docs(range_ref)
   166	    knowledge = _format_knowledge_section(snapshot)
   167	    notes = _build_notes(args.tag, since_ref, commits, docs_changes, knowledge)
   168	
   169	    output_path = Path(args.output)
   170	    output_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
   171	    output_path.write_text(notes, encoding="utf-8")
   172	
   173	    return 0
   174	
   175	
   176	if __name__ == "__main__":
   177	    raise SystemExit(main())

{"output":"     1	# VesselOS Dev Research – Architecture Overview
     2	
     3	## Core System Components
     4	- Pipeline (`pipeline/`): `dispatcher_enhanced.py` drives Garden → Echo → Limnus → Kira, using `intent_parser.py` to map ritual stages and `middleware/` + `metrics.py` for logging, timing, and safety.
     5	- Agents (`library_core/agents/`): Garden manages ritual stages and consent; Echo stylises text and personas; Limnus maintains layered memory and the hash-chained ledger; Kira validates chain integrity, coherence, and release gates.
     6	- Interface (`interface/`, `workspace/`): Glue layers that connect dispatcher events to storage, voice logging, and collaboration endpoints.
     7	- CLI (`vesselos.py`, `cli/`): Unified entry point for routing, audits, and per-agent commands (Prime CLI). All automation flows (CI, releases) invoke this surface.
     8	- Memory & Ledger (`memory/`, `workspaces/<id>/state/`): Vector stores, FAISS indices, and ledger encoders. Limnus appends blocks while tracking L1/L2/L3 stats and `block_hash`.
     9	- Workspaces & Logs (`workspaces/<id>/`): Runtime state snapshots (`state/*.json`) and transcripts (`logs/*.jsonl`, `logs/voice_log.json`) kept per user workspace.
    10	
    11	## Agent Roles & Commands
    12	- **Garden — Ritual Orchestrator** (`stage`, `cycle`, `consent_given`, `ledger_ref`)
    13	  - `python3 vesselos.py garden start|next|open <scroll> [--prev|--reset]|resume|log "<note>"|ledger`
    14	- **Echo — Persona Voice** (`styled_text`, `quantum_state`, `persona`, `glyph`)
    15	  - `python3 vesselos.py echo summon|mode <persona>|say "<text>"|learn "<seed>"|status`
    16	- **Limnus — Memory & Ledger** (`cached`, `memory_id`, `layer`, `block_hash`, `stats`)
    17	  - `python3 vesselos.py limnus cache "<note>"|recall "<query>"|commit-block input '<json>'|encode-ledger|decode-ledger|reindex --backend <name>`
    18	- **Kira — Integrity & Release** (`passed`, `issues`, `checks`, `summary`)
    19	  - `python3 vesselos.py kira validate|test|mentor --apply|mantra|seal|push --run --message "<msg>"|publish --run --release --tag vX.Y.Z --notes-file CHANGELOG_RELEASE.md|codegen --docs [--types]`
    20	
    21	Reference: `AGENTS.md` (root) contains the canonical checklist and extended command catalogue.
    22	
    23	## Pipeline Flow
    24	```
    25	input_text -> intent_parser -> EnhancedMRPDispatcher
    26	    |-- Garden (stage, consent)
    27	    |-- Echo (persona & styled_text)
    28	    |-- Limnus (memory + ledger block)
    29	    `-- Kira (integrity + coherence checks)
    30	-> aggregated results -> voice log + state updates
    31	```
    32	`PipelineContext` threads `input_text`, `user_id`, `workspace_id`, `intent`, timestamps, accumulated `agent_results`, execution `trace`, and `metrics` through each stage. Garden appends to its stage ledger, Echo updates persona state, Limnus writes a ledger block and memory cache, and Kira signs off on integrity.
    33	
    34	## Module Map & Navigation
    35	- Pipeline orchestration: `pipeline/dispatcher_enhanced.py`, `pipeline/intent_parser.py`, `pipeline/middleware/`, `pipeline/metrics.py`.
    36	- Agents & storage: `library_core/agents/`, `library_core/storage.py`, `library_core/workspace/`.
    37	- Interface services: `interface/`, collaborative server (`collab-server/src/`) with TypeScript build via `npm run build`.
    38	- Scripts & tooling: `scripts/` for integration/audit helpers (e.g. `scripts/generate_release_docs.py` for release notes + Kira knowledge exports), `search/` for generated file indices.
    39	- Documentation: `docs/REPO_INDEX.md` (file index), `docs/IN_DEV_SPECS.md` (detailed command/state spec), and `docs/RELEASE_AND_DOCS_PLAN.md` (release checklist).

**Summarizing changes and testing details**

I've gathered all key updates: expanded Kira CLI with test and codegen commands, CI and release workflow tweaks to run these, a new release docs script with generated knowledge artifacts, plus architecture doc updates. I also noted test attempts showing pytest missing but custom Kira tests working. I’ll highlight file paths and line numbers for reference and mention considerations around committing generated docs with timestamps. Next, I’ll prepare a clear final message covering these points.

payload.message:
Expanded Kira automation to cover richer integrity checks, knowledge exports, and release packaging.

**Updates**
- Wired new `kira test` integrity smoke and `kira codegen` knowledge exports into the agent and CLI so CI/ops can exercise them directly (`agents/kira/kira_agent.py:363`, `agents/kira/kira_agent.py:397`, `cli/commands.py:278`, `cli/prime.py:113`).
- Adjusted the primary CI workflow to run the combined Kira smoke test on every push (`.github/workflows/ci.yml:36`).
- Extended the release workflow with the documentation generator step and assets so tagged releases ship release notes plus knowledge artifacts automatically (`.github/workflows/release.yml:31`).
- Added `scripts/generate_release_docs.py` to assemble release notes from git history and Kira exports, together with the generated markdown/typescript snapshots (`scripts/generate_release_docs.py:1`, `docs/kira_knowledge.md:1`, `tools/codex-cli/types/knowledge.d.ts:1`).
- Refreshed the architecture guide to mention the new Kira surfaces and release tooling touchpoint (`docs/ARCHITECTURE.md:11`).

**Tests**
- `python3 vesselos.py kira test`
- `python3 vesselos.py kira codegen --docs --types`
- `python3 -m pytest -q` *(fails: No module named pytest; install dev requirements before retrying)*

Next steps: 1) install `requirements-dev.txt` then rerun `python3 -m pytest -q` to confirm the suite, 2) run `python3 scripts/generate_release_docs.py --tag <next-tag> --types` as part of your release dry-run to verify the new assets.

{"output":"#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Bootstrap script for VesselOS development environments.
# Run from the repository root: ./scripts/bootstrap.sh

PYTHON_VERSION=${PYTHON_VERSION:-"3.10"}
NODE_VERSION=${NODE_VERSION:-"20"}

echo ">>> Creating Python virtual environment (python${PYTHON_VERSION} required)..."
python3 -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate
pip install --upgrade pip
pip install -r requirements.txt

if [ -f requirements-dev.txt ]; then
  echo ">>> Installing dev requirements..."
  pip install -r requirements-dev.txt
fi

echo ">>> Installing Node.js dependencies (requires Node ${NODE_VERSION}+)."
if command -v npm >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  npm install
else
  echo "npm not found. Install Node.js ${NODE_VERSION}+ before continuing." >&2
fi

echo ">>> Bootstrap complete."
echo "Activate the environment with: source .venv/bin/activate"
echo "Then run VesselOS commands via: python3 vesselos.py <agent> <command>"
","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}
